message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CV. 

This paper deals with neural abstractive summarization models, which are commonly studied in the natural language processing (NLP) community. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a training strategy using reinforcement learning, which falls under the scope of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The proposed method involves optimizing the model's factual correctness, which is a metric related to the quality of the generated summary. This aligns with the focus of cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also mentions using an information extraction module, which is a technique commonly used in information retrieval (IR), making cs.IR a likely sub-category. Finally, the paper applies the proposed method to the summarization of radiology reports, which involves analyzing medical images, making cs.CV (Computer Vision) a possible sub-category as well.
